suffixes.usage: attached to verb roots to indicate past action without specific time specification

suffixes.meaning: agent, one who does, coming out

suffixes.meaning: emphatic or marker of completed action

suffixes.usage: present progressive action word
examples: joyoaketaanara (having placed themselves in line all around)

suffixes.usage: attached to nouns to indicate transitive relation with singular object

suffixes.meaning: once it has been done, as soon as it has happened; expresses a completed action and an immediate subsequent action

suffixes.meaning: to do something along the way

chankabaintaanara (having stood up along the way)

kepenyonxonbanon (I will open fully for you)

suffixes.usage: attached to plural nouns to indicate transitive relation with plural object

suffixes.meaning: do as you approach (plural or transitive)

suffixes.usage: Words ending in -bi indicates singular, yet it has an invitational quality

suffixes.usage: nominal/adjectival suffix indicating uniqueness and affection

marks action that occurred days or weeks ago (indefinite past, does not require -ra)

material marker suffix

suffixes.meaning: -ing verb ending (present participial); while doing so, simultaneous action

suffixes.meaning: negation of adjectives or nouns; for verbs: to make an action happen, causative

nashimabanon (will make bathe, with -banon announcement tense)

kanoni (energies that became connected in the past)

suffixes.meaning: definite past tense - many years ago

suffixes.meaning: agent marker for transitive verbs, denoting the one doing the action

command directed to a single person; widely used in icaros and day-to-day language; can be combined with -ma

suffixes.meaning: once I have done; expresses a completed action and a not so immediate subsequent action

suffixes.usage: concessive suffix marking subordinate clauses expressing contrast
